channel.title: How to make a custom Item(not armor)?

item.title: How to make a custom Item(not armor)?
item.dc:creator: @Projext Projext
item.description:
@Projext wrote:

Yer true, It will show up as a null if you don’t have the models G-Zipped and put in with the rest of the models…

Oh and you have to add it to your server aswell, in the items.cfg…

And then in client.java make a case with that on firstclick and make it Tele you to varrock…

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a custom Item(not armor)?

item.title: How to make a custom Item(not armor)?
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

You need the model of it added into the client or it’ll show as a ‘null’.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a custom Item(not armor)?

item.title: How to make a custom Item(not armor)?
item.dc:creator: @Hackerz Hackerz
item.description:
@Hackerz wrote:

I have added a few items into my client so i can use them like teletabs since no one has the Models for them. and when I right click on it it Syas dwarf Remains Varroc Teleport.
this is what i entered for my items can you help me so i can make the item be useable but not have to be put on.the top is unoted The Botem Is Noted Both do the same thing (about to upload pic to show you.

if(i == 10000)
{
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 78;
class8.anInt174 = 2349;
class8.anInt181 = 740;
class8.anInt190 = 528;
class8.anInt198 = 1012;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = -1;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt200 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
class8.aString170 = “Varroc Teleport”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “Used to teleport to Varroc.”.getBytes();
}

if(i == 10001)
{
class8.anInt174 = 2429;
class8.anInt181 = 760;

class8.anInt198 = 28;
class8.anInt204 = 0;

class8.anInt194 = 2;

class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;

class8.aByteArray178 = “Exchange This In A Bank.”.getBytes();
}
